intro: Orchis cordigera var. foliosa, commonly known as the broad-leaved marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wet meadows and marshy areas in Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with a dense root system that helps it thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is notable for its adaptability to wetland environments and its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
